{"blocks":[{"key":"fousi","text":"In a 1.5 ml Eppendorf DNA LoBind tube, mix in the following order:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"415vf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fav8u","text":"Between each addition, pipette mix 10-20 times.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"c554h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fmhi2","text":"Reagent                                                     10.4.1 Flongle Volume            10.4.1 MinION Volume","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":113}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bqh5h","text":"DNA sample from the previous step      30 μl                                           60 μl","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b94nm","text":"Ligation Buffer (LNB)                              12.5 μl                                         25 μl","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7qcfh","text":"NEBNext Quick T4 DNA Ligase              5 μl                                              10 μl","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5i2j1","text":"Ligation Adapter (LA)                              2.5 μl                                          5 μl","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6lqj2","text":"Total                                                          50 μl                                           100 μ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f0dp5","text":"If you have access to a Quantus or Qubit fluorimeter, now is a good time to quantify 2uL of DNA in your sample. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2kn2p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"jssa","text":"It is recommend loading 5 fmol to 10 fmol of this final prepared library onto your flow cells. Loading more than 20 fmol of DNA can reduce the rate of duplex read capture. Dilute the library in Elution Buffer if required.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b3ooo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e9t8p","text":"https://www.promega.com/resources/tools/biomath/","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6733b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"eacsr","text":"For 900bp length DNA (what our ITS1F-4 rxns appear to average, with adapters), we are looking for:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1mv13","text":"10 fmol - 20 fmol = .006ug - .012ug of DNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9eq2s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cfo6p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3l3gc","text":"For a 22 ng/uL sample (Quantus quantification):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e1oh0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"af8il","text":"22ng              1ug","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4ai26","text":"--------   *   --------       =     0.022ug/uL             (22/1000=0.022)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9aq66","text":"1uL                1000ng","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dqp9b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6a87j","text":"0.022ug/uL    *   5uL (elution buffer; or x7 if you did not quantify using 2uL)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8kjmc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6l1lh","text":"=  0.11 ug DNA in sample of 5uL elution buffer. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"85kea","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b6lc4","text":"*Note: the 0.11 in the calculations below will change based on your individual DNA amount.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6blv5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"39hej","text":"**Also note: The ONT protocol suggests using additional EB in order to make concentration adjustments. As there is not a lot of the reagent in the standard packets, and it is not possible to buy more individually, I have been using molecular water for this step with no ill effect. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2fo6c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bd1u1","text":"Flongle 10.4.1","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bhote","text":"How much additional molecular water to have 5uL needed for the next step give us correct amount of DNA? ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3ef8h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9k71s","text":"0.11ug / xuL = 0.010ug (17 fmol DNA)   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dp4j7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7ar1q","text":"x = 11uL   * 5uL  =  55uL - 5uL (or 7 if you did not quanitfy) = 50uL","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"69itg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4keep","text":"Overall summary:  ([DNA Concentration] / 1000 * 5 * 100 * 5) - 5 = [Amount of H2O to add]","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1r2cp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"eqsis","text":"So at 0.022ug/uL quantification, add an additional 50uL of molecular water to have right concentration to use 5uL for the next step with Flongle. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b1hdf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"96nms","text":"11ng/uL sample comes out to adding an additional 22.5 uL of molecular water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3k2q4","text":"31ng/uL sample comes out to adding an additional 72.5 uL of molecular water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2un3i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bflse","text":"I would use 50 uL of extra molecular water if you are not able to quantify your sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
